content.webTitle: Hot under the collar over penalty in NatWest's cooling off period

fields.headline: Hot under the collar over penalty in NatWest's cooling off period
fields.bodyText: I invested £6,000 in a NatWest bond but decided to close it immediately, within the cooling off period. The day after cancelling I found that the bank had taken £6,000 from my current account and given me an overdraft for £5,212. I complained and was given an appointment, but when I turned up I was told it would be better to have the adviser there in person. I was given another date, but the adviser phoned saying not to worry as my money would be returned. I heard nothing and asked again to meet the adviser. This time he drafted a letter for me to sign. I didn't want to since it included something about me agreeing to close the bond and being subject to a financial penalty. He said it was normal procedure and the only way I would get my money back. The bombshell dropped when NatWest wrote that, as I had closed the bond, I was liable to pay a £587 penalty. GY, London NatWest simply ignored your instructions to cancel the investment. It admits you suffered a financial loss and is putting you back to where you would have been if it had never recommended the investment. It is refunding the penalty payment plus interest and adding £100 compensation. You can email Margaret Dibben at your.problems@observer.co.uk or write to Margaret Dibben, Your Problems, The Observer, Kings Place, 90 York Way, London N1 9GU. Please include a phone number.
